itemDescription: British expert on the Middle East, author of "The Unraveling: High Hopes and Missed Opportunities in Iraq"

wikipedia_page.main:
Emma Sky, OBE is a British expert on conflict, reconciliation and stability, who has worked mainly in the Middle East. She served in Iraq as the political advisor to US General Ray Odierno and General David Petraeus during the surge. She is currently Director of the International Leadership Center at Yale University,   overseeing the Yale World Fellows program and other initiatives. She is a Senior Fellow at Yale's Jackson Institute for Global Affairs, where she lectures on Middle East politics and global affairs. 
She is the author of The Unravelling: High Hopes and Missed Opportunities in Iraq (2015) and In a Time of Monsters: Travelling in a Middle East in Revolt (2019).

response: * Emma Sky, The Unravelling: High Hopes and Missed Opportunities in Iraq
* Emma Sky (born 1968), Middle East expert and political advisor to U.S. General Ray Odierno.
| Kate TempestJean-Christophe RufinAyaan Hirsi AliJulian BagginiEmma Sky

Since 2015, Emma Sky has been Director of the Yale World Fellows. Sky oversaw the transition of the program to the Jackson Institute for Global Affairs, and in 2016 secured a $16 million contribution from the Starr Foundation and Maurice R. Greenberg.
